whatIs.title: What is Cuneiform Translator?
whatIs.description: Cuneiform Translator is an advanced AI-powered tool that decodes ancient cuneiform scripts from Mesopotamian civilizations. Supporting Sumerian, Akkadian, and Babylonian languages, VibeTrans uses cutting-edge machine learning trained on thousands of historical texts to provide scholarly-accurate translations. This tool is indispensable for historians, archaeologists, linguists, and anyone fascinated by humanity's earliest writing system dating back to 3200 BCE.

howto.title: How to Use the Cuneiform Translator
howto.description: Translating ancient cuneiform has never been easier. Follow these steps to decode Mesopotamian texts with VibeTrans AI technology.

steps.title: Select Your Script Type
steps.description: Choose between Sumerian (oldest known writing system), Akkadian (language of Babylonian and Assyrian empires), or Babylonian (administrative and literary texts). Each script type uses different grammatical structures and vocabulary, and VibeTrans AI automatically adjusts translation algorithms accordingly.

steps.title: Input Your Text or Upload Files
steps.description: Type cuneiform transliteration directly, paste copied text from academic sources, or upload .txt and .docx files containing transliterated cuneiform. VibeTrans accepts standard academic transliteration conventions used in Assyriology, including diacritical marks for vowel length and consonant emphasis.

steps.title: AI Analyzes Historical Context
steps.description: VibeTrans AI examines your text using trained models based on cuneiform corpus databases. The system identifies grammatical patterns, recognizes common phrases from legal codes and religious texts, and applies contextual understanding of Mesopotamian culture to produce accurate translations rather than literal word-for-word conversions.

steps.title: Review and Download Results
steps.description: Examine your translation with confidence scores for accuracy. VibeTrans provides transliteration, literal translation, and contextual interpretation. Download results as formatted documents or copy text directly. For complex texts, the tool highlights uncertain translations and suggests alternative interpretations based on scholarly consensus.

items.title: The World's Oldest Writing System
items.description: Cuneiform, invented by ancient Sumerians around 3200 BCE in Mesopotamia (modern-day Iraq), is humanity's first known writing system. Originally developed for accounting and administrative records, it evolved over 3000 years to express complex literature, scientific observations, and legal codes. The word 'cuneiform' comes from Latin 'cuneus' (wedge), describing the characteristic wedge-shaped marks made by pressing a reed stylus into wet clay tablets.

items.title: Used Across Ancient Civilizations
items.description: Remarkably, cuneiform wasn't limited to one language or culture. Over its millennia-long history, at least 15 different ancient languages were written in cuneiform script, including Sumerian, Akkadian, Babylonian, Assyrian, Elamite, Hittite, and Urartian. This makes cuneiform somewhat like the Latin alphabet today—a writing system adapted by many cultures to record their own distinct languages. The Epic of Gilgamesh, one of humanity's oldest literary works, was written in Akkadian cuneiform.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Cuneiform Translation
faqs.subtitle: Common questions from scholars and history enthusiasts

item-1.question: Is VibeTrans Cuneiform Translator free to use?
item-1.answer: Yes, VibeTrans offers free basic cuneiform translation for academic and educational purposes. This includes standard translations of Sumerian, Akkadian, and Babylonian texts with unlimited usage for students, educators, and independent researchers. Premium features include advanced dialect analysis, batch processing of multiple documents, detailed grammatical breakdowns, and priority processing for time-sensitive research projects. Premium subscriptions start at $9.99 monthly.

item-2.question: How do I translate cuneiform texts with VibeTrans?
item-2.answer: Step 1: Select your script type (Sumerian, Akkadian, or Babylonian) from the dropdown menu. Step 2: Input transliterated cuneiform text into the text box or upload a .txt or .docx file containing transliteration. Step 3: Click 'Translate' and VibeTrans AI will process your text, typically in 2-5 seconds. Step 4: Review the translation results, which include transliteration, literal translation, and contextual interpretation. Step 5: Download your translation or copy the text for use in research papers and academic work.

item-3.question: What cuneiform scripts and dialects does VibeTrans support?
item-3.answer: VibeTrans supports three major ancient Mesopotamian languages: Sumerian (3200-2000 BCE, the oldest known written language), Akkadian (2500-100 BCE, Semitic language of Babylonian and Assyrian empires), and Babylonian (1895-539 BCE, administrative and literary dialect). Within these, the AI recognizes multiple historical dialects including Old Akkadian, Old Babylonian, Middle Babylonian, Neo-Babylonian, and Neo-Assyrian, applying appropriate grammatical rules and vocabulary for each period.

item-4.question: Can I translate from English to cuneiform script?
item-4.answer: Yes! VibeTrans supports bidirectional translation. You can translate from English to transliterated cuneiform and from cuneiform to English. When translating English to cuneiform, the AI converts your modern text into appropriate Sumerian, Akkadian, or Babylonian vocabulary and grammar, then provides standard academic transliteration. This feature is particularly useful for creating educational materials, comparative linguistics research, or understanding how ancient scribes would have expressed modern concepts.

item-5.question: How accurate is VibeTrans cuneiform translation compared to human experts?
item-5.answer: VibeTrans achieves approximately 75-85% accuracy for standard literary and administrative texts, based on comparison with published expert translations. Accuracy is highest for well-documented text types like legal codes, royal inscriptions, and literary works with extensive parallel texts. Accuracy decreases for fragmentary tablets, rare vocabulary, and highly poetic or metaphorical language. The tool is designed as a research accelerator rather than replacement for human expertise—it provides reliable preliminary translations that scholars should verify for publication-quality work.

item-6.question: Does VibeTrans work with cuneiform images or only transliteration?
item-6.answer: Currently, VibeTrans accepts transliterated cuneiform text (romanized representation using standard Assyriological conventions). We're developing optical character recognition (OCR) capabilities to process photographs and scans of actual cuneiform tablets, but this feature is still in beta testing. For now, users should input text using standard transliteration from published sources or personal transcription. Many online cuneiform databases like CDLI provide transliterated texts compatible with VibeTrans.
